Context:
The Centre for Business programs at George Brown College offer various specializations including Financial Management, Investment Management, Retirement Planning, Tax Planning, Insurance and Risk Management, and Estate Planning. These programs are accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).

The two-year B133 diploma in this program is approved through FP Canada and covers the core curriculum required to pursue certain designations. Students may find employment as financial advisors, financial services representatives, customer service representatives, or investment advisors upon graduation.

George Brown College has adopted a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative for Centre for Business students who are required to bring their own laptops. The Library Learning Commons offers open access computers and equipment that can be borrowed on a short-term basis.

For more information regarding field education opportunities, contact the Centre for Business at business@georgebrown.ca.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business – Finance Program B133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The two-year diploma in question is an approved program through FP Canada for pursuing the QAFP™ examination. It has a direct pathway to the B302 Honours Bachelor of Commerce degree program at George Brown College, also approved through FP Canada for the CFP® designation. The diploma is called "B133" and individuals with a Program GPA of 3.0 or higher may transfer into Semester 5 of B302 to complete their degree. The text also mentions that effective April 1, 2022, individuals wishing to pursue the CFP® certification require a minimum bachelor’s degree, while those seeking QAFP™ certification require a minimum 2-year college diploma.

Additional certifications or credentials that graduates of this program may pursue include the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) through the Canadian Securities Institute and the Life License Qualification Program (LLQP) through Oliver’s Learning or another approved provider. Note that the requirements for each designation/certification are set by the granting body, not George Brown College.

Contact information for inquiries:
- Katherine Friesen: kfriesen@georgebrown.ca
- Tracey Britt: tbritt1@georgebrown.ca
- Carolyn Fallis: cfallis@georgebrown.ca
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business – Finance Program B133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Extracted Information:

1. The designations/certifications QAFP™ and CFP® are not administered by George Brown College, but by their respective granting bodies.
2. To qualify for these designations/certifications, one needs to follow the process listed on their respective websites and meet all applicable requirements.
3. For future study options, refer to the transfer guide.
4. To graduate from the B133 program, 27 courses need to be completed: 24 mandatory courses and 3 General Education Electives.
5. Depending on placement test results, students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) or MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation). These courses do not count toward the 27 courses required for graduation and will be charged extra.
6. Students must make up any failed or dropped courses before graduation.
7. General Education courses should be chosen from at least two of the following categories: Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI).
8. The required courses for Semester 1 are BUS 1038, COMM 2000, ECON 1032, FIN 1003, MATH 1191, MARK 1020, and CMMK 1087.
9. The required courses for Semester 2 are ACCT 1001 and COMP 1010.
10. No specific information related to the program offered by the college was provided in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business – Finance Program B133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Extracted Information:

The text provides information about courses offered in different semesters for a Finance program at George Brown College. Here are the details:

Semester 1:
- Accounting Fundamentals I (NONE, COMP 1010)
- Business Computer Applications I (NONE)
- Professional Communications I (COMM 1034)
- Fundamentals of Financial Planning (NONE)
- Organizational Behaviour (NONE)
- Select One General Education Elective

Courses offered in Semester 3 and their prerequisites:
- Business Presentation Skills (BUS 1056, COMM 1007)
- Canadian Investments I (FIN 2061, NONE)
- Consumer Behaviour & Financial Needs (FIN 1035, NONE)
- Retirement Planning (FIN 1011, FIN 1035)
- Business and Family Law (LAW 1011, NONE)
- Quantitative Methods I (STAT 1010, MATH 1191)
- Select One General Education Elective

Courses offered in Semester 4 and their prerequisites:
- Taxation I (ACCT 2028, ACCT 1001)
- Post Retirement & Estate Planning (FIN 2052, FIN 1011)
- Canadian Investments II (FIN 2062, FIN 2061)
- Insurance in Financial Planning (FIN 2003, NONE)
- Money Management Software (FIN 1011, NONE)
- Career Planning & Development (STS 1037, NONE)
- Select One General Education Elective

The George Brown College Finance program has agreements with several universities in Canada, the United States, and abroad for credit transfer. The graduate of this program will be able to process and maintain financial records, prepare and present financial information, generate financial reports, contribute to the development and implementation of a financial plan, develop marketing strategies, establish and maintain professional networking and business relationships, analyze economic variables within a Canadian context, and develop personal and professional ongoing strategies with ethics and values.

Context:
Program Offered: Finance
Tuition and Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,973.00 (for programs starting in Fall 2022)
- International Tuition: $17,455.00 (for programs starting in Fall 2023)
Additional Costs: Subject to change for programs starting at later dates

Industry-credentialing Exams:
- Canadian Securities Course I and II (CSC I and CSC II)
- Qualified Associate Financial Planner (QAFP®) Exam
- Certified Financial Planner® (CFP®) Exam
- Life License Qualification Program (LLQP)

Exam Fees: Not included in the program fees and are an additional cost
Exam Providers: FP Canada, Canadian Securities Institute, Oliver's Learning (or another approved provider), Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Ontario

Financial Assistance: Approved for OSAP funding (provided the applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria)

Admission Requirements: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), grade 11 math (C, M or U) or grade 12 (C or U).

Note: A degree requirement is being introduced to be eligible to become a CFP Professional, visit the FP Canada website for more info. If a student wishes to pursue a degree, they should see the “Future Studies” section below.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Business – Finance Program B133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
* The text is about applying to George Brown College, specifically for math courses in grades 11 and 12, or considering upgrading English and math for mature students (19 years old or above without an Ontario Secondary School Diploma).
* Mature students can take the Admissions Assessment for English and math or consider upgrading.
* Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions.
* Proficiency in English communications is necessary for success in the program.
* International students should visit specific pages for application information and country-specific requirements.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through George Brown College Online Application System.
* Information sessions are held on a regular basis.
* Contact information for domestic student admissions inquiries and international student recruitment representatives is provided.
* Financial aid and fees inquiries can be made to the Financial Aid Office.
* Entry advising is available by making an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options.
